{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Personal Assistant & Facility / Secretariat Manager",
  "description": "Workforce Group is a Management Consulting and Outsourcing Professional Services Firm. Following its inception in July 2004, Workforce Management Centre Limited (Workforce) has built an enviable reputation as the leading indigenous management and professional services consulting firm in Nigeria. Drawing from its Deep Domain Expertise, in the area of organizational effectiveness and employee performance, the Company is positioned to assist businesses across diverse sectors of the economy in their quest to create sustainable value for their stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Personal Assistant &amp; Facility / Secretariat Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Our client is seeking an Executive Personal Assistant to the Director &mdash; a strategic role that combines high-level executive support, secretariat management, and facility/estate oversight.
	This is a unique opportunity to work directly with the Director, ensuring seamless operations across executive, administrative, and facility functions while managing international travel and immigration processes.
	The position is located in&nbsp;Benin, with international travel


What You&rsquo;ll Do


	Provide comprehensive support to the Director &mdash; managing schedules, correspondence, and executive communications.
	Oversee secretariat functions, including meeting coordination, agenda preparation, minutes, and records management.
	Ensure smooth operations of the Director&rsquo;s office premises and estate, liaising with vendors, contractors, and service providers.
	Manage international travel, visas, immigration compliance, and logistics for the Director and key executives.
	Uphold the highest standards of confidentiality, professionalism, and efficiency across all responsibilities.


Requirements


	Strong background in executive administration &mdash; diary management, executive correspondence, and stakeholder liaison.
	Expertise in facility/estate oversight, vendor management, and health &amp; safety compliance.
	Proven ability in travel and immigration management, including visas, permits, and international logistics.
	Excellent communication, report writing, and presentation skills.
	A proactive, resourceful professional with integrity, adaptability, and exceptional organizational skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;executivesearch@workforcegroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-15",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-30",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Workforce Group"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

Executive Personal Assistant & Facility / Secretariat Manager Job at Workforce Group




        
    

        
        Workforce Group is a Management Consulting and Outsourcing Professional Services Firm. Following its inception in July 2004, Workforce Management Centre Limited (Workforce) has built an enviable reputation as the leading indigenous management and professional services consulting firm in Nigeria. Drawing from its Deep Domain Expertise, in the area of organizational effectiveness and employee performance, the Company is positioned to assist businesses across diverse sectors of the economy in their quest to create sustainable value for their stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Personal Assistant & Facility / Secretariat Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Our client is seeking an Executive Personal Assistant to the Director — a strategic role that combines high-level executive support, secretariat management, and facility/estate oversight.
	This is a unique opportunity to work directly with the Director, ensuring seamless operations across executive, administrative, and facility functions while managing international travel and immigration processes.
	The position is located in Benin, with international travel


What You’ll Do


	Provide comprehensive support to the Director — managing schedules, correspondence, and executive communications.
	Oversee secretariat functions, including meeting coordination, agenda preparation, minutes, and records management.
	Ensure smooth operations of the Director’s office premises and estate, liaising with vendors, contractors, and service providers.
	Manage international travel, visas, immigration compliance, and logistics for the Director and key executives.
	Uphold the highest standards of confidentiality, professionalism, and efficiency across all responsibilities.


Requirements


	Strong background in executive administration — diary management, executive correspondence, and stakeholder liaison.
	Expertise in facility/estate oversight, vendor management, and health & safety compliance.
	Proven ability in travel and immigration management, including visas, permits, and international logistics.
	Excellent communication, report writing, and presentation skills.
	A proactive, resourceful professional with integrity, adaptability, and exceptional organizational skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: executivesearch@workforcegroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Engineer",
  "description": "Infinion Technologies designs productivity boosting solutions aimed at delivering business value and making infrastructure and applications available to enterprises. We are a technology and business solutions Company established with the objective of providing world class solutions to Enterprise Businesses. We seek to offer individuals and organizations sublime services to improve operational efficiency. As a certified Microsoft Partner, we never lose sight of the role we play in helping businesses automate their processes and solve their problems in the local and international community.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking an experienced Data Engineer to join our growing data team.
	The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in building and optimizing data pipelines, managing large-scale data integration, and working with Microsoft&rsquo;s modern data stack (Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Power BI, etc.).
	You will play a key role in designing, implementing, and supporting data solutions that power analytics, reporting, and business decision-making.


Key Responsibilities


	Data Pipeline Development:
	
		Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL/ELT pipelines for batch and real-time data.
		Develop parameterized and reusable pipelines using Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, or Synapse Pipelines.
		Optimize large-scale data ingestion and transformation processes using Databricks, PySpark, SQL, and Dataflows.
	
	
	Data Integration &amp; Migration:
	
		Work on data migration projects, moving workloads from on-premises to Azure Cloud or Microsoft Fabric.
		Integrate data from multiple sources (databases, APIs, Event Hubs, third-party systems, etc.).
		Implement data partitioning, chunking, and metadata-driven approaches for performance optimization.
	
	
	Data Modeling &amp; Storage:
	
		Design and maintain Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, and Delta Lake structures.
		Build and manage semantic models for reporting with Power BI.
		Collaborate with analysts and business stakeholders to create efficient data models supporting analytics use cases.
	
	
	Governance, Security &amp; Compliance:
	
		Ensure proper data governance, lineage, and cataloging using Microsoft Purview.
		Manage access and security via Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD), roles, and service principals.
		Implement best practices for data quality, integrity, and compliance with organizational and industry standards.
	
	
	Collaboration &amp; Documentation:
	
		Work closely with data analysts, BI developers, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions.
		Document technical designs, processes, and best practices for maintainability.
		Contribute to knowledge sharing and mentoring within the data team.
	
	
	Key Skills &amp; Qualifications
	
		Qualification:&nbsp;Bachelor&#39;s Degree.
		Professional Skills:
		
			4+ years of proven experience in a Data Engineering role (or similar).
			Strong problem-solving skills and ability to optimize data processes.
			Excellent communication and ability to translate technical solutions into business language.
			Experience in client-facing or cross-functional roles is an advantage.
			Relevant Microsoft certifications is a plus
		
		
		Technical Skills:
		
			Strong experience with Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, and Power BI.
			Proficiency in SQL (T-SQL, query optimization, stored procedures).
			Experience with PySpark, Python, or Databricks-like environments for big data processing.
			Knowledge of data modeling (star schema, data vault, dimensional modeling).
			Familiarity with real-time streaming (Event Hubs, Kafka, Service Bus, or similar).
			Experience with data governance tools (e.g., Microsoft Purview).
			Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines, Git, and DevOps practices.
			
			
			
		
		
	
	


Salary
N400,000 - N600,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;careers@infinion.co&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-15",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Infinion Technologies"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

    }

  },

    }

Data Engineer Job at Infinion Technologies




        
    

        
        Infinion Technologies designs productivity boosting solutions aimed at delivering business value and making infrastructure and applications available to enterprises. We are a technology and business solutions Company established with the objective of providing world class solutions to Enterprise Businesses. We seek to offer individuals and organizations sublime services to improve operational efficiency. As a certified Microsoft Partner, we never lose sight of the role we play in helping businesses automate their processes and solve their problems in the local and international community.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Engineer
     

            
    



Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking an experienced Data Engineer to join our growing data team.
	The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in building and optimizing data pipelines, managing large-scale data integration, and working with Microsoft’s modern data stack (Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Power BI, etc.).
	You will play a key role in designing, implementing, and supporting data solutions that power analytics, reporting, and business decision-making.


Key Responsibilities


	Data Pipeline Development:
	
		Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL/ELT pipelines for batch and real-time data.
		Develop parameterized and reusable pipelines using Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, or Synapse Pipelines.
		Optimize large-scale data ingestion and transformation processes using Databricks, PySpark, SQL, and Dataflows.
	
	
	Data Integration & Migration:
	
		Work on data migration projects, moving workloads from on-premises to Azure Cloud or Microsoft Fabric.
		Integrate data from multiple sources (databases, APIs, Event Hubs, third-party systems, etc.).
		Implement data partitioning, chunking, and metadata-driven approaches for performance optimization.
	
	
	Data Modeling & Storage:
	
		Design and maintain Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, and Delta Lake structures.
		Build and manage semantic models for reporting with Power BI.
		Collaborate with analysts and business stakeholders to create efficient data models supporting analytics use cases.
	
	
	Governance, Security & Compliance:
	
		Ensure proper data governance, lineage, and cataloging using Microsoft Purview.
		Manage access and security via Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD), roles, and service principals.
		Implement best practices for data quality, integrity, and compliance with organizational and industry standards.
	
	
	Collaboration & Documentation:
	
		Work closely with data analysts, BI developers, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions.
		Document technical designs, processes, and best practices for maintainability.
		Contribute to knowledge sharing and mentoring within the data team.
	
	
	Key Skills & Qualifications
	
		Qualification: Bachelor's Degree.
		Professional Skills:
		
			4+ years of proven experience in a Data Engineering role (or similar).
			Strong problem-solving skills and ability to optimize data processes.
			Excellent communication and ability to translate technical solutions into business language.
			Experience in client-facing or cross-functional roles is an advantage.
			Relevant Microsoft certifications is a plus
		
		
		Technical Skills:
		
			Strong experience with Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, and Power BI.
			Proficiency in SQL (T-SQL, query optimization, stored procedures).
			Experience with PySpark, Python, or Databricks-like environments for big data processing.
			Knowledge of data modeling (star schema, data vault, dimensional modeling).
			Familiarity with real-time streaming (Event Hubs, Kafka, Service Bus, or similar).
			Experience with data governance tools (e.g., Microsoft Purview).
			Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines, Git, and DevOps practices.
			
			
			
		
		
	
	


Salary
N400,000 - N600,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: careers@infinion.co using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement and Production Officer",
  "description": "Greenswealth Corporate Services Limited is a one-stop shop for Promotional products and Corporate gift items that help companies to amplify their brand image with an array of exotic gift selections. Greenswealth Corporate Services Limited serves several Local and Multinational Companies and Corporate Bodies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement&nbsp;and Production&nbsp;Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
Education &amp; Qualifications:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Business Administration, Production/Operations Management, or a related field.
	Professional certifications (e.g., CIPS, CPSM, PMP, or relevant training) will be an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 2-4 years of experience in procurement, supply chain, or production/operations.
	Proven experience in vendor sourcing, price negotiation, and contract management.
	Experience in coordinating production processes, inventory management, and quality control.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of procurement processes, policies, and best practices.
	Ability to plan, coordinate, and monitor production schedules to meet targets.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship management skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and ERP/procurement software.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Team-oriented with good leadership and organisational skills.


Other Requirements:


	High level of integrity, accountability, and professionalism.
	Strong understanding of budgeting and cost management.
	Knowledge of industry-specific compliance, safety, and quality standards.
	Flexibility to adapt to changing production and procurement demands.
	Must reside close to location.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers.greenswealthcorp@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",

  },

Procurement and Production Officer Job at Greenswealth Corporate Services Limited




        
    

        
        Greenswealth Corporate Services Limited is a one-stop shop for Promotional products and Corporate gift items that help companies to amplify their brand image with an array of exotic gift selections. Greenswealth Corporate Services Limited serves several Local and Multinational Companies and Corporate Bodies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement and Production Officer

Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
Education & Qualifications:
     

            
    




	Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Business Administration, Production/Operations Management, or a related field.
	Professional certifications (e.g., CIPS, CPSM, PMP, or relevant training) will be an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 2-4 years of experience in procurement, supply chain, or production/operations.
	Proven experience in vendor sourcing, price negotiation, and contract management.
	Experience in coordinating production processes, inventory management, and quality control.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of procurement processes, policies, and best practices.
	Ability to plan, coordinate, and monitor production schedules to meet targets.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship management skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and ERP/procurement software.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Team-oriented with good leadership and organisational skills.


Other Requirements:


	High level of integrity, accountability, and professionalism.
	Strong understanding of budgeting and cost management.
	Knowledge of industry-specific compliance, safety, and quality standards.
	Flexibility to adapt to changing production and procurement demands.
	Must reside close to location.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers.greenswealthcorp@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Restaurant General Manager",
  "description": "Toasties Limited is a fast-casual dining restaurant chain located in Lagos, Nigeria. We specialize in hot toasted fusion sandwiches and offer a range of specials. Our focus is to bring out-of-the-box meal selections to Lagos&rsquo; on-the-go consumer. Using quality ingredients and efficient service, Toasties aims to put variety, creativity and great tasting products in the hands of every customer!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant General Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos,
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	The General Manager is responsible for overseeing the overall operations of the restaurant to ensure profitability, efficiency, and exceptional guest experiences.
	The role involves managing staff, ensuring consistent food quality, maintaining high service standards, overseeing budgets, and ensuring compliance with health, safety, and regulatory requirements.
	The GM acts as the link between ownership and day-to-day operations, driving business growth and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily restaurant operations, ensuring smooth coordination between kitchen and front-of-house.
	Develop and implement operational strategies to boost efficiency and profitability.
	Manage both cloud and physical kitchen operations, ensuring consistency in quality, taste, and service.
	Monitor food quality, service standards, and guest satisfaction consistently.
	Train and manage staff across all departments while fostering teamwork and a positive work culture.
	Monitor inventory levels and ensure proper stock control to minimize waste.
	Manage budgets, monitor financial performance, and ensure cost-efficient use of resources.
	Prepare and analyze reports on sales, costs, and overall performance, recommending improvements where necessary.
	Actively engage with guests, respond to feedback, and resolve complaints professionally.
	Support marketing initiatives, promotions, and events to drive customer traffic and brand awareness.
	Work with the executive team on menu planning, pricing, and product innovation.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and hygiene standards across all operations.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a HND qualification / Bachelor&#39;s Degree with at least 4 years of work experience.


Key Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong leadership, communication, and people management skills.
	Solid understanding of restaurant operations, financial management, and customer service.
	Problem-solving and decision-making skills under pressure.
	Ability to multitask and manage diverse teams across physical and cloud kitchens.
	Knowledge of food safety, health regulations, and labor laws.
	Strong organizational and analytical abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@biscuitboneblog.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-15",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-30",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Toasties Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {

Restaurant General Manager Job at Toasties Limited




        
    

        
        Toasties Limited is a fast-casual dining restaurant chain located in Lagos, Nigeria. We specialize in hot toasted fusion sandwiches and offer a range of specials. Our focus is to bring out-of-the-box meal selections to Lagos’ on-the-go consumer. Using quality ingredients and efficient service, Toasties aims to put variety, creativity and great tasting products in the hands of every customer!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant General Manager

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos,
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	The General Manager is responsible for overseeing the overall operations of the restaurant to ensure profitability, efficiency, and exceptional guest experiences.
	The role involves managing staff, ensuring consistent food quality, maintaining high service standards, overseeing budgets, and ensuring compliance with health, safety, and regulatory requirements.
	The GM acts as the link between ownership and day-to-day operations, driving business growth and customer satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily restaurant operations, ensuring smooth coordination between kitchen and front-of-house.
	Develop and implement operational strategies to boost efficiency and profitability.
	Manage both cloud and physical kitchen operations, ensuring consistency in quality, taste, and service.
	Monitor food quality, service standards, and guest satisfaction consistently.
	Train and manage staff across all departments while fostering teamwork and a positive work culture.
	Monitor inventory levels and ensure proper stock control to minimize waste.
	Manage budgets, monitor financial performance, and ensure cost-efficient use of resources.
	Prepare and analyze reports on sales, costs, and overall performance, recommending improvements where necessary.
	Actively engage with guests, respond to feedback, and resolve complaints professionally.
	Support marketing initiatives, promotions, and events to drive customer traffic and brand awareness.
	Work with the executive team on menu planning, pricing, and product innovation.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and hygiene standards across all operations.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a HND qualification / Bachelor's Degree with at least 4 years of work experience.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Strong leadership, communication, and people management skills.
	Solid understanding of restaurant operations, financial management, and customer service.
	Problem-solving and decision-making skills under pressure.
	Ability to multitask and manage diverse teams across physical and cloud kitchens.
	Knowledge of food safety, health regulations, and labor laws.
	Strong organizational and analytical abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@biscuitboneblog.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
